leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 可信与不确定性量化生态

queries: [WEB] machine learning model monitoring tools github

tools.name: VeriGauge
tools.one_line_profile: A united toolbox for running major robustness verification approaches for Deep Neural Networks
tools.detailed_description: VeriGauge is a comprehensive toolbox designed for the robustness verification of Deep Neural Networks (DNNs). It integrates various state-of-the-art verification methods, allowing researchers to evaluate and compare the robustness of DNNs against adversarial perturbations and other uncertainties.

tools.name: Advertorch
tools.one_line_profile: A toolbox for adversarial robustness research in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: Advertorch is a Python toolbox for adversarial robustness research, specifically designed for PyTorch. It provides implementations of various adversarial attacks, defenses, and robust training methods, enabling researchers to evaluate and improve the resilience of machine learning models.

tools.name: Robust Statistical Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for robust statistical analyses
tools.detailed_description: The Robust Statistical Toolbox is a collection of MATLAB functions designed to perform robust statistical analyses. It includes methods for robust correlation, regression, and other statistical tests that are resistant to outliers and violations of parametric assumptions, suitable for scientific data analysis.

tools.name: DeepRobust
tools.one_line_profile: A PyTorch adversarial library for attack and defense methods on images and graphs
tools.detailed_description: DeepRobust is a comprehensive PyTorch library for adversarial attacks and defenses, covering both image and graph data. It provides a unified platform for researchers to simulate attacks, evaluate model robustness, and develop defense mechanisms against adversarial examples.

tools.name: DataShifts
tools.one_line_profile: Library for quantifying and analyzing distribution shifts in data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to quantify and analyze distribution shifts (covariate shift, prior probability shift, and concept shift) in machine learning datasets, helping to diagnose model performance degradation.

tools.name: Evidently
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation library for Evidence Accumulation Models in cognitive science
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for simulating Evidence Accumulation Models (EAMs), which are used in cognitive science and psychology to model decision-making processes and reaction times.

tools.name: Adaptive Alerting
tools.one_line_profile: Anomaly detection system for streaming time series
tools.detailed_description: A library for performing anomaly detection on streaming time series data, featuring automated model selection to adapt to changing data patterns, suitable for monitoring scientific or industrial sensor data.

tools.name: PeakPickingTools
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for modal parameter extraction
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox designed to extract modal parameters from frequency response functions using a robust peak-picking identification technique, applicable in structural dynamics and signal processing.

tools.name: PolaronMobility.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Feynman's variational path-integral model for Fröhlich polarons
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package that implements Feynman's variational path-integral model to calculate temperature-dependent polaron mobilities and other observables in materials science physics.

tools.name: Robustar
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive toolbox for robust vision classification
tools.detailed_description: An interactive toolbox designed to improve the robustness of vision classification models through data augmentation and adversarial training, facilitating the creation of robust AI models.

tools.name: URET
tools.one_line_profile: Universal Robustness Evaluation Toolkit for NLP
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit developed by IBM for evaluating the robustness of Natural Language Processing (NLP) models against evasion attacks, supporting various attack methods and metrics.

tools.name: HEART Library
tools.one_line_profile: Hardened Extension of the Adversarial Robustness Toolbox
tools.detailed_description: An extension of the Adversarial Robustness Toolbox (ART) designed to support the assessment of adversarial AI vulnerabilities in Test & Evaluation workflows, providing hardened implementations for practical deployment.

tools.name: Frouros
tools.one_line_profile: Library for drift detection in machine learning systems
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python library dedicated to drift detection in machine learning systems, providing implementations of various concept drift and data drift detection algorithms.

tools.name: fd-shifts
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark and toolkit for failure detection under distribution shifts
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark and toolkit for evaluating failure detection methods under distribution shifts in image classification, specifically focused on biomedical imaging applications.

tools.name: 2DMatGMM
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for detection and classification of 2D material flakes
tools.detailed_description: An open-source robust machine learning platform designed for the real-time detection and classification of 2D material flakes from optical microscopy images.

tools.name: OpenOOD
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive benchmarking codebase for generalized Out-of-Distribution (OOD) detection
tools.detailed_description: OpenOOD provides a unified and standardized benchmark for Generalized Out-of-Distribution (OOD) detection, covering various OOD detection methods, datasets, and evaluation metrics to facilitate fair comparison and research.

tools.name: CellDrift
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for inferring temporal perturbation effects in single-cell data
tools.detailed_description: CellDrift is a Python tool designed to evaluate the effects of temporal perturbations on single-cell data, helping to identify and analyze drift or changes in cell states over time.

tools.name: robust-elm-irls
tools.one_line_profile: Robust Regularized Extreme Learning Machine for regression
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of Robust Regularized Extreme Learning Machine (ELM) using Iteratively Reweighted Least Squares (IRLS) to provide robust regression capabilities in the presence of outliers.

tools.name: Decorrelated-Weighted-Regression
tools.one_line_profile: Stable prediction algorithm for model misspecification and distribution shift
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Decorrelated Weighted Regression (DWR) designed to achieve stable predictions and handle agnostic distribution shifts and model misspecification.

tools.name: kramersmoyal
tools.one_line_profile: Library for calculating Kramers-Moyal coefficients from stochastic data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to compute Kramers-Moyal coefficients for stochastic data of any dimension and to any desired order, useful for analyzing stochastic processes and drift-diffusion dynamics.

tools.name: SDDObench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for Streaming Data-Driven Optimization with Concept Drift
tools.detailed_description: SDDObench is a benchmark suite designed for evaluating algorithms in the context of Streaming Data-Driven Optimization (SDDO), specifically focusing on scenarios involving concept drift.

tools.name: Eurybia
tools.one_line_profile: Library for monitoring model drift and data validation
tools.detailed_description: Eurybia is a Python library designed to monitor machine learning model drift over time and ensure model deployment security through data validation and consistency checks.

tools.name: CIFAR-10 Challenge
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for evaluating adversarial robustness on CIFAR-10
tools.detailed_description: A challenge framework and codebase provided by MadryLab to explore and benchmark the adversarial robustness of neural networks specifically on the CIFAR-10 dataset.

tools.name: MNIST Challenge
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for evaluating adversarial robustness on MNIST
tools.detailed_description: A challenge framework and codebase provided by MadryLab to explore and benchmark the adversarial robustness of neural networks specifically on the MNIST dataset.

tools.name: robustness
tools.one_line_profile: Library for training and evaluating neural networks with adversarial robustness
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch library developed by MadryLab for experimenting with, training, and evaluating neural networks, with a primary focus on adversarial robustness and robust optimization.

tools.name: T2N
tools.one_line_profile: Interface between MATLAB and NEURON for robust electrophysiological modeling
tools.detailed_description: T2N is a toolbox that provides an interface between MATLAB and the NEURON simulation environment, facilitating robust electrophysiological modeling and compartmental modeling of neurons.

tools.name: drifter
tools.one_line_profile: R library for concept drift and shift detection in predictive models
tools.detailed_description: Drifter is an R package designed to identify and visualize concept drift and concept shift in predictive models, helping to maintain model performance over time.

tools.name: NannyML
tools.one_line_profile: Post-deployment data science library for drift detection and performance estimation
tools.detailed_description: NannyML is a Python library for post-deployment monitoring of machine learning models. It estimates model performance without ground truth and detects data drift to ensure reliability in production.

tools.name: CanarySEFI
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for evaluating robustness of image recognition models
tools.detailed_description: CanarySEFI is a comprehensive framework for evaluating the robustness of deep learning-based image recognition models, incorporating various attack and defense algorithms and evaluation metrics.

tools.name: OODRobustBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for adversarial robustness under distribution shift
tools.detailed_description: OODRobustBench is a benchmark suite designed to analyze and evaluate the adversarial robustness of machine learning models specifically under conditions of distribution shift.

tools.name: PkBoost
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive GBDT implementation in Rust for concept drift
tools.detailed_description: PkBoost is a Gradient Boosting Decision Tree (GBDT) library built in Rust that features adaptive mechanisms to handle concept drift and changing data distributions efficiently.

tools.name: RobustBench
tools.one_line_profile: Standardized adversarial robustness benchmark
tools.detailed_description: RobustBench is a standardized benchmark and library for evaluating the adversarial robustness of image classification models, providing a leaderboard and easy access to robust models.

tools.name: RobustSP Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for robust signal processing
tools.detailed_description: The RobustSP toolbox provides a collection of robust statistical methods and algorithms for signal processing, accompanying the book 'Robust Statistics for Signal Processing'.

tools.name: OnlineTSF
tools.one_line_profile: Proactive model adaptation framework against concept drift for online time series forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to handle concept drift in online time series forecasting by proactively adapting models. It implements the method from KDD'25 to maintain forecasting accuracy in dynamic environments.

tools.name: alibi-detect
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithms for outlier, adversarial, and drift detection
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python library focused on outlier detection, adversarial detection, and drift detection. It provides a suite of algorithms to monitor machine learning models and data distributions for deviations and anomalies.

tools.name: GEO-Bench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for Foundation Models in Earth Monitoring
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite designed to evaluate foundation models for Earth monitoring tasks. It facilitates the assessment of model performance across various geospatial data analysis scenarios.

tools.name: Face-Robustness-Benchmark
tools.one_line_profile: Adversarial robustness evaluation library for face recognition
tools.detailed_description: A library and benchmark for evaluating the adversarial robustness of face recognition models. It provides tools to test models against various adversarial attacks to ensure reliability.

tools.name: odin-pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: Out-of-Distribution detection method for neural networks
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the ODIN (Out-of-DIstribution detector for Neural networks) method, which improves the detection of out-of-distribution examples in pre-trained neural networks.

tools.name: GRB
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Robustness Benchmark for Graph Machine Learning
tools.detailed_description: A scalable, unified, modular, and reproducible benchmark for evaluating the adversarial robustness of Graph Machine Learning models. It aids in understanding model vulnerabilities under adversarial attacks on graph data.

tools.name: parallel-ADWIN
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable detection of concept drifts with Parallel Adaptive Windowing
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the Parallel Adaptive Windowing (ADWIN) algorithm for scalable detection of concept drifts in data streams, enabling efficient monitoring of changing data distributions.

tools.name: DIW
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Importance Weighting for distribution shift
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of 'Rethinking Importance Weighting for Deep Learning under Distribution Shift', providing methods to handle distribution shifts in deep learning models via importance weighting.

tools.name: TorchDrift
tools.one_line_profile: Drift detection library for PyTorch models
tools.detailed_description: A library dedicated to drift detection for PyTorch models, offering various statistical tests and methods to monitor data distribution changes and model performance degradation.

tools.name: MagNet
tools.one_line_profile: Defense framework against adversarial examples
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of MagNet, a two-pronged defense mechanism against adversarial examples in neural networks, focusing on detecting and reforming adversarial inputs.

tools.name: Adversarial Robustness Toolbox (ART)
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for Machine Learning Security and Robustness
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for machine learning security, providing tools for evasion, poisoning, extraction, and inference attacks and defenses. It enables robust evaluation and hardening of ML models.

tools.name: UB-GOLD
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for Unsupervised Graph-Level OOD and Anomaly Detection
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark unifying unsupervised graph-level out-of-distribution (OOD) detection and anomaly detection, facilitating the evaluation of methods on graph data.

tools.name: DoM_Utrecht
tools.one_line_profile: ImageJ plugin for molecule detection and drift correction
tools.detailed_description: An ImageJ plugin for Detection of Molecules (DoM), offering features for SMLM 2D/3D localizations, drift correction, and chromatic aberration correction in microscopy data.

tools.name: Adv-SS-Pretraining
tools.one_line_profile: Adversarial Robustness via Self-Supervised Pre-Training
tools.detailed_description: Code implementation for improving adversarial robustness through self-supervised pre-training followed by fine-tuning, as presented in CVPR 2020.

tools.name: Adversarial-Contrastive-Learning
tools.one_line_profile: Robust Pre-Training by Adversarial Contrastive Learning
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Adversarial Contrastive Learning (ACL) for robust pre-training of deep learning models, enhancing their resistance to adversarial attacks.

tools.name: AugMax
tools.one_line_profile: Adversarial Composition of Random Augmentations for Robust Training
tools.detailed_description: A framework for robust training that uses adversarial composition of random augmentations (AugMax) to improve model robustness and generalization.

tools.name: Ordinal-patterns-based-analysis
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for ordinal patterns based entropy analysis
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for ordinal-patterns-based analysis, including permutation entropy, robust permutation entropy, and conditional entropy, useful for time series analysis.

tools.name: cyclops
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for evaluating and monitoring clinical AI models
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit designed for the healthcare domain to evaluate and monitor AI models, specifically addressing drift and robustness in clinical settings.

tools.name: anomaly_detection_bootstrapping
tools.one_line_profile: Bootstrapped statistical workflow for anomaly detection
tools.detailed_description: A software system applying bootstrapped statistical workflows to identify and quantify data abnormalities, such as measurement errors and out-of-distribution samples in large datasets.

tools.name: Defect-GLM
tools.one_line_profile: Large Visual-Language Model for Industrial Defect Monitoring
tools.detailed_description: A large visual-language model specifically designed for monitoring and detecting defects in industrial settings, serving as a specialized tool for robust visual inspection.

tools.name: MOA
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for Big Data stream mining and concept drift detection
tools.detailed_description: Massive Online Analysis (MOA) is a framework for data stream mining, including a collection of machine learning algorithms for classification, regression, clustering, and specifically concept drift detection.

tools.name: MetaShift
tools.one_line_profile: Dataset for evaluating contextual distribution shifts
tools.detailed_description: A dataset collection derived from Visual Genome for evaluating contextual distribution shifts and training conflicts, aiding in the development of robust ML models.

tools.name: AutoML-IDS-Defense
tools.one_line_profile: AutoML-based IDS and adversarial attack defense
tools.detailed_description: Code implementing AutoML-based Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) and defense mechanisms against adversarial attacks for zero-touch network security.

tools.name: MSANA
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-Stage Automated Online Network Data Stream Analytics
tools.detailed_description: A framework for online data stream analytics that implements methods to address concept drift and model drift in IIoT systems.

tools.name: OASW
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight Concept Drift Detection and Adaptation Framework
tools.detailed_description: An online learning method and framework designed to detect and adapt to concept drift in IoT data streams efficiently.

tools.name: PWPAE
tools.one_line_profile: Ensemble Framework for Concept Drift Adaptation
tools.detailed_description: An ensemble framework (PWPAE) for adapting to concept drift in IoT data streams, utilizing the River library for online learning.

tools.name: ULDA
tools.one_line_profile: Unsupervised Few-Shot Learning via Distribution Shift-based Augmentation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of ULDA, a method for unsupervised few-shot learning that leverages distribution shift-based augmentation to improve model generalization.

tools.name: GraphMETRO
tools.one_line_profile: Mitigating Complex Graph Distribution Shifts
tools.detailed_description: A method (GraphMETRO) for mitigating complex distribution shifts in graph data using a Mixture of Aligned Experts approach.

tools.name: IF-Defense
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Adversarial Point Cloud Defense via Implicit Function
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of IF-Defense, a method for defending against adversarial attacks on 3D point clouds using implicit function-based restoration.

tools.name: Likelihood-Regret
tools.one_line_profile: Out-of-Distribution Detection Score for VAEs
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Likelihood Regret, an effective score for detecting out-of-distribution samples using Variational Auto-encoders (VAEs).

tools.name: NegLabel
tools.one_line_profile: Negative Label Guided OOD Detection with VLMs
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of NegLabel, a method for Out-of-Distribution detection that utilizes negative labels and pre-trained Vision-Language Models.

tools.name: DeePCtools
tools.one_line_profile: A wrapped package for Data-enabled Predictive Control (DeePC) implementation
tools.detailed_description: DeePCtools is a Python package designed for implementing Data-enabled Predictive Control (DeePC) and Robust DeePC designs. It supports multiple objective functions, facilitating the application of data-driven control strategies in engineering and scientific systems.

tools.name: ADWIN
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive sliding window algorithm for detecting change and concept drift in data streams
tools.detailed_description: ADWIN (ADaptive WINdowing) is an algorithm for detecting changes in the distribution of a data stream. It maintains updated statistics by automatically adjusting the window size based on the detected drift, serving as a black-box component for learning and mining algorithms.

tools.name: AdvBox
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox to generate adversarial examples and benchmark model robustness
tools.detailed_description: AdvBox is a comprehensive toolbox for generating adversarial examples to fool neural networks across multiple frameworks (PaddlePaddle, PyTorch, Caffe2, MxNet, Keras, TensorFlow). It provides command-line tools and APIs to benchmark the robustness of machine learning models against adversarial attacks.

tools.name: StrikePy
tools.one_line_profile: Python toolbox for structural identifiability and observability analysis of nonlinear models
tools.detailed_description: StrikePy is a Python toolbox designed for analyzing the structural properties of nonlinear dynamic models, specifically focusing on structural identifiability and observability. It is useful in systems biology and control theory for model validation and experimental design.

tools.name: STRIKE-GOLDD
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for analysing structural properties of nonlinear models
tools.detailed_description: STRIKE-GOLDD is a MATLAB toolbox for analyzing structural identifiability, observability, accessibility, and controllability of nonlinear dynamic models. It aids researchers in determining whether model parameters can be uniquely estimated from experimental data.

tools.name: PromptInject
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for quantitative analysis of LLM robustness to adversarial prompt attacks
tools.detailed_description: PromptInject is a modular framework designed to assemble prompts and quantitatively analyze the robustness of Large Language Models (LLMs) against adversarial prompt attacks (prompt injection). It helps researchers evaluate safety risks in LLM applications.

tools.name: dryft
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for correcting signal drift in ground reaction force data
tools.detailed_description: dryft is a Python package specifically designed to correct signal drift in ground reaction force (GRF) data collected during treadmill running. It provides signal processing utilities to improve the quality of biomechanical data.

tools.name: KeystoneML
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for robust end-to-end machine learning on Apache Spark
tools.detailed_description: KeystoneML is a software framework designed to simplify the construction of large-scale, robust machine learning pipelines on Apache Spark. It focuses on end-to-end optimization and robustness in ML workflows.

tools.name: Foolbox
tools.one_line_profile: A Python toolbox to create adversarial examples that fool neural networks
tools.detailed_description: Foolbox is a Python library that provides a comprehensive collection of adversarial attacks to benchmark the robustness of machine learning models. It supports multiple frameworks including PyTorch, TensorFlow, and JAX, allowing researchers to evaluate model vulnerability to perturbations.

tools.name: model-vs-human
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for evaluating model robustness against human perception on OOD datasets
tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking tool and dataset designed to compare the out-of-distribution (OOD) generalization capabilities of deep learning models against human visual perception. It provides a standardized evaluation protocol for measuring robustness shifts.

tools.name: concept-drift
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithms for detecting concept drift in data streams
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing various algorithms for detecting concept drift and changes in data streams, useful for monitoring the stability of data distributions in scientific and industrial applications.

tools.name: boxkite
tools.one_line_profile: Concept drift monitoring instrumentation for model servers
tools.detailed_description: A library designed to monitor machine learning models in production for concept drift. It integrates with model serving infrastructure to track distribution shifts and ensure model reliability over time.

tools.name: RobustToolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Robust regression toolbox for neuroimaging data analysis
tools.detailed_description: A toolbox developed by the Cognitive & Affective Neuroscience Lab for performing robust regression analysis specifically tailored for neuroimaging data, helping to handle outliers and noise in brain imaging studies.

tools.name: nn_robust_attacks
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of robust evasion attacks against neural networks
tools.detailed_description: A reference implementation of the Carlini & Wagner (C&W) attacks and other robust evasion techniques. It serves as a standard tool for evaluating the adversarial robustness of neural network models.

tools.name: TreeMix Scripts
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis pipeline for TreeMix population genetics tool
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts and workflows to automate the analysis of population data using TreeMix. It includes functionality for bootstrapping, selecting migration events, and visualizing maximum likelihood trees with drift and residual statistics.

tools.name: POMDP
tools.one_line_profile: Solver for Partially Observable Markov Decision Processes
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of algorithms for solving Partially Observable Markov Decision Processes (POMDPs), which are mathematical frameworks used for modeling decision-making under uncertainty in various scientific and engineering domains.

tools.name: CleverHans
tools.one_line_profile: Adversarial example library for constructing attacks and defenses
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to benchmark machine learning systems' vulnerability to adversarial examples. It provides standard implementations of attacks and defenses to help researchers build more robust models.

tools.name: data-drift
tools.one_line_profile: Metrics observability and troubleshooting tool for data drift
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for metrics observability and troubleshooting, specifically focusing on data drift detection and monitoring in data pipelines.

tools.name: Minotor
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning production monitoring and bias detection tool
tools.detailed_description: Open source software for monitoring machine learning models in production, enabling users to maintain control over models, detect bias, and explain results.

tools.name: oodeel
tools.one_line_profile: Post-hoc out-of-distribution detection library for TensorFlow and PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A simple, compact, and hackable library for post-hoc deep out-of-distribution (OOD) detection, compatible with already trained TensorFlow or PyTorch image classifiers.

tools.name: Deepchecks
tools.one_line_profile: Continuous validation and testing suite for ML models and data
tools.detailed_description: A holistic open-source solution for AI & ML validation, enabling thorough testing of data and models from research to production, including drift and robustness checks.

tools.name: Deepchecks Monitoring
tools.one_line_profile: Continuous validation and monitoring service for ML models in production
tools.detailed_description: The monitoring component of the Deepchecks ecosystem, designed for continuous validation of machine learning models and data in production environments.

tools.name: Delve
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch model training and layer saturation monitor
tools.detailed_description: A tool for monitoring PyTorch model training dynamics, specifically focusing on layer saturation to aid in debugging and optimizing deep learning models.

tools.name: Gate
tools.one_line_profile: Drift detection module for machine learning pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A dedicated module for detecting data drift within machine learning pipelines, facilitating robust model maintenance.

tools.name: Watermark Robustness Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for evaluating DNN image classification watermarking robustness
tools.detailed_description: The official implementation of the IEEE S&P'22 paper, providing a toolbox to evaluate the robustness of deep neural network image classification watermarking techniques.

tools.name: DiffAI
tools.one_line_profile: System for training provably robust neural networks
tools.detailed_description: A certifiable defense system against adversarial examples that trains neural networks to be provably robust, developed by ETH SRI Lab.

tools.name: OpenCossan
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for reliability analysis and uncertainty quantification
tools.detailed_description: The open-source core engine of COSSAN software, providing algorithms for reliability analysis, simulation, sensitivity analysis, and robust design.

tools.name: ETSI Watchdog
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time data drift detection for ML pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A tool for real-time data drift detection and monitoring within machine learning pipelines, ensuring model reliability over time.

tools.name: Dredge
tools.one_line_profile: Robust online multiband drift estimation for electrophysiology data
tools.detailed_description: A tool for robust online multiband drift estimation specifically designed for electrophysiology data analysis, enabling stable tracking of neural signals over time.

tools.name: Evidently
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source ML and LLM observability framework for drift detection and monitoring
tools.detailed_description: An open-source framework to evaluate, test, and monitor ML models and data pipelines. It provides comprehensive metrics for data drift, target drift, and model performance, supporting both tabular data and text (LLMs).

tools.name: Adversarial Image Defenses
tools.one_line_profile: Library for countering adversarial images using input transformations
tools.detailed_description: A library providing implementations of input transformation techniques to defend against adversarial attacks on image classifiers, supporting research in robust computer vision.

tools.name: ImageNet Adversarial Training
tools.one_line_profile: State-of-the-art adversarially robust ImageNet classifiers
tools.detailed_description: Provides pre-trained models and training code for ImageNet classifiers that achieve state-of-the-art adversarial robustness, serving as a benchmark and resource for robustness research.

tools.name: FastForward Concept Drift
tools.one_line_profile: Unsupervised methods for detecting concept drift
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing implementations of unsupervised methods for detecting concept drift in data streams, developed as part of the Fast Forward Labs research cycle.

tools.name: FairPut
tools.one_line_profile: Machine Learning Fairness Framework with LightGBM
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to enhance fairness, robustness, and explainability in machine learning models, specifically leveraging LightGBM for tabular data.

tools.name: AutoGBT
tools.one_line_profile: AutoML for lifelong learning under concept drift
tools.detailed_description: An AutoML tool designed for lifelong machine learning settings, capable of classifying large volume high cardinality data streams while adapting to concept drift.

tools.name: AutoAttack
tools.one_line_profile: Reliable evaluation of adversarial robustness
tools.detailed_description: A widely used framework for reliably evaluating the adversarial robustness of image classifiers using an ensemble of diverse parameter-free attacks.

tools.name: LeanVerifier
tools.one_line_profile: Formal verification framework for ML properties using Lean 4
tools.detailed_description: A framework for specifying and proving properties such as robustness, fairness, and interpretability of machine learning models using the Lean 4 theorem prover.

tools.name: FedDC
tools.one_line_profile: Federated Learning with Local Drift Decoupling and Correction
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the FedDC algorithm for handling non-IID data in federated learning via local drift decoupling and correction.

tools.name: RobNets
tools.one_line_profile: Neural Architecture Search for robust architectures
tools.detailed_description: A framework for searching for robust neural network architectures against adversarial attacks using Neural Architecture Search (NAS).

tools.name: Distribution Shift Framework
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for analyzing distribution shifts
tools.detailed_description: A framework for fine-grained analysis of distribution shifts in machine learning, supporting research into generalization and robustness.

tools.name: RETVec
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient and adversarially-robust text vectorizer
tools.detailed_description: A multilingual, adversarially-robust text vectorizer designed to be efficient and resilient against character-level manipulations and attacks.

tools.name: StableCox
tools.one_line_profile: Stable Cox Regression for Survival Analysis under Distribution Shifts
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of Stable Cox Regression for performing survival analysis that is robust to distribution shifts in the data.

tools.name: ft-drift
tools.one_line_profile: Drift detection for OpenAI fine-tuning datasets
tools.detailed_description: A tool to check for data drift between two OpenAI multi-turn chat JSONL files, useful for monitoring dataset quality in LLM fine-tuning workflows.

tools.name: OOD Error Detection Baseline
tools.one_line_profile: Baseline for detecting misclassified and OOD examples
tools.detailed_description: A baseline implementation for detecting misclassified and out-of-distribution examples in neural networks, serving as a standard benchmark for OOD detection research.

tools.name: SS-OOD
tools.one_line_profile: Self-Supervised Learning for OOD Detection
tools.detailed_description: Implements self-supervised learning techniques to improve out-of-distribution detection in neural networks.

tools.name: CROWN-IBP
tools.one_line_profile: Certified defense against adversarial examples
tools.detailed_description: A certified defense framework against adversarial examples using CROWN (bound propagation) and IBP (Interval Bound Propagation), including GPU implementations for verification.

tools.name: Wild-Time
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for Natural Temporal Distribution Shift
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite for evaluating machine learning models under natural temporal distribution shifts, providing datasets and evaluation protocols.

tools.name: Adversarial Robustness PyTorch
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of adversarial training and robustness methods
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch library implementing various adversarial training techniques and robustness methods, including those from DeepMind papers, facilitating research in robust ML.

tools.name: PatchCleanser
tools.one_line_profile: Certifiably robust defense against adversarial patches
tools.detailed_description: A defense mechanism that provides certifiable robustness against adversarial patch attacks for image classifiers.

tools.name: PatchGuard
tools.one_line_profile: Provably robust defense against adversarial patches
tools.detailed_description: A provably robust defense framework against adversarial patches utilizing small receptive fields and masking techniques.

tools.name: OptiSpline
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for robust optimization with spline relaxations
tools.detailed_description: A user-friendly C++ toolbox designed for solving robust optimization problems using spline relaxations, developed by the MECO research group.

tools.name: Sync Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient and robust music synchronization library
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing reference implementations for efficient, robust, and accurate music synchronization based on dynamic time warping (DTW).

tools.name: Responsible AI Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Suite of tools for model assessment and monitoring
tools.detailed_description: A suite of tools providing model and data exploration and assessment user interfaces and libraries that enable a better understanding of AI systems, including error analysis, fairness, and interpretability.

tools.name: RobustDG
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for domain generalization and robust ML
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for building machine learning models that generalize to unseen domains and are robust to privacy and other attacks, facilitating research in domain generalization.

tools.name: RobustLearn
tools.one_line_profile: Library for robust machine learning algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A library focused on robust machine learning techniques for responsible AI, providing implementations of algorithms designed to handle noise and distribution shifts.

tools.name: MIT-LL Responsible AI Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Library for evaluating AI robustness
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-centric library developed by MIT Lincoln Laboratory for evaluating and enhancing the robustness of AI technologies against various threats and shifts.

tools.name: Menelaus
tools.one_line_profile: Concept and data drift detection library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing online and batch-based concept and data drift detection algorithms to monitor and maintain machine learning model performance.

tools.name: MLflow
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for end-to-end machine learning lifecycle
tools.detailed_description: An open source platform to manage the ML lifecycle, including experimentation, reproducibility, deployment, and a central model registry, essential for scientific experiment tracking.

tools.name: TableShift
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for distribution shift in tabular data
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark library for evaluating machine learning models under distribution shift specifically for tabular data datasets.

tools.name: ModelFox
tools.one_line_profile: Platform to train, deploy, and monitor ML models
tools.detailed_description: A platform that simplifies the training, deployment, and monitoring of machine learning models, providing tools for observing model performance in production.

tools.name: ImageNet Testbed
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for measuring robustness to distribution shifts
tools.detailed_description: A codebase and dataset collection serving as a testbed for measuring the robustness of image classification models to natural distribution shifts.

tools.name: NIC-RobustBench
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for neural image compression and robustness analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive open-source toolkit designed for analyzing the robustness of neural image compression models.

tools.name: LTrack
tools.one_line_profile: Security observability framework for model file loading
tools.detailed_description: A security observability framework designed to capture, inspect, and investigate file loading operations during ML/AI model initialization, aiding in forensic analysis.

tools.name: WhyShift
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark package for distribution shift patterns
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing a benchmark with various specified distribution shift patterns to evaluate model performance under shifting conditions.

tools.name: ENTERPRISE
tools.one_line_profile: Pulsar timing analysis and noise analysis toolbox
tools.detailed_description: ENTERPRISE (Enhanced Numerical Toolbox Enabling a Robust PulsaR Inference SuitE) is a code for pulsar timing analysis, aimed at noise analysis, gravitational-wave searches, and timing model analysis.

tools.name: Neptune Client
tools.one_line_profile: Client library for Neptune experiment tracking
tools.detailed_description: The client library for Neptune.ai, an experiment tracker for foundation model training that provides tracking, observability, and evaluations.

tools.name: ML Performance Monitoring
tools.one_line_profile: Package for sending model inference data and metrics
tools.detailed_description: A Python package developed by New Relic for sending model inference data, data metrics, and model metrics to their observability platform.

tools.name: SRQL
tools.one_line_profile: Semi-automated Robust Quantification of Lesions Toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A shell-based toolbox for the semi-automated and robust quantification of lesions in medical imaging, designed to facilitate neuroimaging analysis.

tools.name: WILDS
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark of in-the-wild distribution shifts
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark toolkit for evaluating machine learning models against distribution shifts, providing data loaders, evaluators, and default models for robust ML research.

tools.name: BibMon
tools.one_line_profile: Predictive models for fault detection and condition monitoring
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing predictive models and tools for fault detection, soft sensing, and process condition monitoring in industrial and scientific contexts.

tools.name: TraceML
tools.one_line_profile: Engine for ML/Data tracking and drift detection
tools.detailed_description: A library for tracking machine learning experiments, visualizing data, and detecting drift, serving as the tracking engine for Polyaxon.

tools.name: SecML
tools.one_line_profile: Library for Secure and Explainable Machine Learning
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for evaluating the security of machine learning algorithms against adversarial attacks and explaining their decisions.

tools.name: crepes-weighted
tools.one_line_profile: Conformal prediction with covariate shift handling
tools.detailed_description: An extension of the crepes package enabling weighted conformal prediction and conformal predictive systems to handle covariate shifts in data.

tools.name: Radicalbit AI Monitoring
tools.one_line_profile: Solution for monitoring AI models in production
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library and platform for monitoring AI models, detecting data drift, and ensuring model reliability in production environments.

tools.name: driftscan
tools.one_line_profile: Data analysis for transit radio interferometers
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the data analysis of transit radio interferometers, specifically designed for 21cm cosmology research.

tools.name: MC-Calib
tools.one_line_profile: Robust calibration toolbox for multi-camera systems
tools.detailed_description: A generic and robust calibration toolbox for multi-camera systems, facilitating precise geometric calibration for computer vision and robotics applications.

tools.name: Robustness Gym
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation toolkit for machine learning robustness
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive toolkit for evaluating the robustness of machine learning models through structured testing and slice-based analysis.

tools.name: vetiver-r
tools.one_line_profile: MLOps tool for versioning, deploying, and monitoring models in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package for MLOps that provides tools to version, share, deploy, and monitor machine learning models, including functionality for drift monitoring.

tools.name: POHMM
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of Partially Observable Hidden Markov Models
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing the Partially Observable Hidden Markov Model (POHMM), suitable for statistical modeling and time series analysis in scientific contexts where states are not directly observable.

tools.name: LangKit
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source toolkit for monitoring Large Language Models (LLMs)
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive toolkit for monitoring Large Language Models, extracting signals from prompts and responses to ensure safety, security, and quality. It provides metrics for text quality, relevance, and sentiment analysis, aiding in the robust deployment of LLMs in research and production.

tools.name: whylogs
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source standard for data and ML logging
tools.detailed_description: A library for data logging that enables data quality monitoring and model performance tracking over time. It supports privacy-preserving data collection and drift detection, essential for maintaining the robustness of machine learning pipelines in scientific and industrial applications.

tools.name: whylogs-java
tools.one_line_profile: Java library for whylogs data logging and monitoring
tools.detailed_description: The Java implementation of the whylogs library, allowing for profiling and monitoring of ML data pipelines within Java-based environments. It provides capabilities for tracking data quality and detecting drift.

tools.name: PyABSA
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for aspect-based sentiment analysis and text adversarial defense
tools.detailed_description: An open-source framework for Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis (ABSA) that includes modules for text classification, augmentation, and adversarial defense. It serves as a tool for robust NLP research and application.

tools.name: RcppML
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance R package for NMF and machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance R package providing fast and robust Non-negative Matrix Factorization (NMF) and divisive clustering algorithms. It is designed for scientific data analysis, particularly in fields like bioinformatics where NMF is a key method.

tools.name: CinnaMon
tools.one_line_profile: Library to detect, explain, and correct data drift
tools.detailed_description: A Python library offering tools to detect, explain, and correct data drift in machine learning systems. It helps in maintaining model reliability by monitoring distribution shifts.
